c74object.name: ossia.model
c74object.digest: Declare patcher as an Ossia model
c74object.description: Create a node under which several ossia.parameter or ossia.model can subscribe. Allows to create complex and nested address hierarchies describing your patcher's features as a namespace

outlet.name: Info outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

objarg.name: node name
objarg.description: ossia.model requires an argument defining a node name in the ossia namespace. This is mandatory, and each ossia.model within a upper-level model or a device must have a unique name - if several nodes are named similarly, instances (such as name.1, name.2, etc...) will be created.

method.name: namespace
method.digest: Output list of all parameters and their current values
method.description: The namespace message to the leftmost inlet outputs the list of all parameters registered under this node, and their current values

method.name: preset
method.description: Sending the preset save /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will write a list of all parameters and their values to the the disk, under the file /path/to/file.txt Sending the preset load /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will load a list of all parameters and their values from the the file /path/to/file.txt, and recall the values to the parameters

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The priority attribute allows on to order how several values of a same hierarchical level can be recalled

attribute.name: hidden
attribute.description: The hidden attribute allows to hide a model from remote clients - this can be useful e.g. for "internal" that we don't want to give access to.
